hero.title: Life with Dignity,
hero.description: Federally certified hospice care provider serving Southern California with bilingual English/Traditional Chinese services. Medicare, Medi-Cal, and HMO coverage up to 100%.

services.title: Comprehensive Hospice
services.description: Our Chinese-speaking medical professionals provide personalized care arrangements for patients and families, including home care, inpatient care, continuous care, and respite care services.

homecare.title: Home Care
homecare.description: Routine visits, intermittent and on-demand care provided in the comfort of your home.

inpatient.title: Inpatient Care
inpatient.description: Professional facility care arrangements when specialized nursing is needed.

continuous.title: Continuous Care
continuous.description: Shift-based nursing care to help patients through difficult periods.

respite.title: Respite Care
respite.description: Up to 5 days of relief care for families and primary caregivers in professional facilities.

services.additionalInfo: We also provide pain management, social worker services, bereavement support, volunteer programs, medication services, and medical equipment - all as part of our comprehensive hospice care.

about.title: Federally Certified
about.description: IE Community Hospice Inc. is a federally certified Medicare/Medi-Cal hospice care provider serving 5 counties in Southern California. Our mission: providing compassionate care that enhances quality of life with dignity, comfort, and hope.

items.name: Mrs. Wang
items.content: The Chinese-speaking staff made all the difference. They understood our cultural needs and provided care with genuine compassion and respect.

items.name: Chen Family
items.content: Available 24/7 when we needed them most. The pain management and emotional support helped our father maintain his dignity throughout his journey.

items.name: Rodriguez Family
items.content: Medicare covered everything. We didn't have to worry about costs and could focus on spending quality time together during those precious final months.

contact.title: We're Here to Help
contact.description: Don't worry about insurance - call 909-321-2255. We have insurance specialists ready to answer all your questions and concerns.

form.title: Send us a message
form.messagePlaceholder: How can we help you and your family?

phone.title: 24/7 Support Line
phone.note: Nurse on-call available outside business hours

emergency.title: 24/7 Emergency Support
emergency.description: For medical emergencies, call 911. For urgent hospice care needs:

footer.description: IE Community Hospice Inc. - Federally certified Medicare/Medi-Cal hospice care provider serving Southern California with bilingual services and culturally sensitive care.

legal.copyright: © {year} IE Community Hospice Inc. All rights reserved.

areas.title: Serving Southern
areas.description: IE Community Hospice proudly serves families across four major Southern California counties, providing compassionate hospice care wherever you call home.

office.title: Main Office Location
office.address:
600 N. Mountain Ave, Suite D105
Upland, CA 91786

settings.description: We provide flexible care settings wherever you need us most:

dignity.title: Living with Comfort,
dignity.description: Hospice care is not giving up. When all treatment options have been exhausted or methods are no longer effective, hospice care provides another way for patients to live comfortably, peacefully, and with dignity without curative care.

benefits.title: Benefits of Hospice Care
benefits.description: The benefits of hospice bring strength to patients and their caregivers, providing comfort and support during the most challenging times.

decision.title: Who Makes the Decision?
decision.description: Patients, family members, and healthcare providers make the hospice care decision together. This is a medical care decision that respects patient wishes and family values.

eligibility.title: Eligibility Requirements
eligibility.description: Physicians determine if a patient qualifies for hospice care based on terminal prognosis of six months or less and declining functional status.

info.title: Frequently Asked
info.description: Get answers to common questions about hospice care, insurance coverage, and eligibility requirements. We're here to help guide you through this important decision.

payment.question: Who pays for hospice care?
payment.answer: Medicare, Medi-Cal, and most HMO and private insurance plans cover hospice services up to 100%. We handle all insurance paperwork and authorization.

eligibility.question: How does one qualify for hospice?
eligibility.answer: Physicians determine patient eligibility based on a terminal prognosis of six months or less and declining functional status. We work with your doctor to assess eligibility.

location.question: Where is hospice care provided?
location.answer: We provide services wherever the patient chooses - homes, care facilities, hospitals, assisted living centers, and any place they call home.

hero.title: Our Complete Range of
hero.description: IE Community Hospice provides a full spectrum of hospice care services designed to enhance quality of life for patients and families during end-of-life care.

overview.title: Eight Essential
overview.description: Our interdisciplinary team provides comprehensive support through eight core service areas, ensuring comfort, dignity, and quality of life for patients and families.

painManagement.title: Pain Management
painManagement.description: Expert pain control and symptom management to ensure patient comfort and quality of life.

onCallNursing.title: 24-Hour On-Call Nursing
onCallNursing.description: Round-the-clock nursing support available for urgent needs and crisis periods.

personalCare.title: Personal Care Assistance
personalCare.description: Hospice aides provide assistance with daily living activities while maintaining patient dignity.

socialWorker.title: Social Worker Services
socialWorker.description: Emotional support, resource coordination, family counseling, and advance care planning assistance.

bereavement.title: Bereavement Services
bereavement.description: Ongoing grief counseling and support for families before, during, and after loss.

volunteer.title: Volunteer Program
volunteer.description: Trained volunteers providing companionship, emotional support, and practical assistance.

medication.title: Medication Services
medication.description: All hospice-related medication management, delivery, and coordination.

equipment.title: Equipment Services
equipment.description: Necessary medical equipment and supplies to ensure patient comfort and care.

levelsOfCare.title: Four Levels of
levelsOfCare.description: We provide different levels of care based on patient needs and acuity, ensuring appropriate support during all stages of the hospice journey.

routine.title: Routine Care
routine.description: Regular home visits and intermittent care for stable patients managing their daily care needs.

continuous.title: Continuous Care
continuous.description: Intensive shift-based nursing care during crisis periods to help patients through difficult times.

inpatient.title: General Inpatient Care
inpatient.description: Short-term facility care when symptom control requires hospitalization or specialized nursing.

respite.title: Inpatient Respite Care
respite.description: Up to 5 days of relief care in professional facilities to give primary caregivers a break.

team.title: Experienced
team.description: Our compassionate team of healthcare professionals works together to provide comprehensive, coordinated care for patients and families.

cta.title: Ready to Learn More
cta.description: Our team is available 24/7 to answer your questions and help determine if hospice care is right for you or your loved one.
